data.question: What is the empirical formula of Al-soc-MOF-1?

What is the gravimetric CO2 uptake for Al-soc-MOF-1 at 298 K and 40 bar?
Which Al-soc-MOF compound has the highest gravimetric methane uptake at 35 bar and 298 K?
Is the methane sorption isotherm at 112 K for Al-soc-MOF-1 fully reversible?
Does Al-soc-MOF-1 exhibit the highest deliverable uptake for O2 reported so far?
Is the Qst of CH4 adsorption for Al-soc-MOF-1 higher at low loading compared to the CH4 latent heat of evaporation?
What is the working capacity of Al-soc-MOF-1 for CH4 storage at 258 K and 80 bar?
What is the method used for low pressure gas adsorption measurements?
data.answer: Fully automated micropore gas analyzer Autosorb-IC

data.question: Does the volumetric CH4 storage working capacity for Al-soc-MOF-1 increase when the temperature is decreased from 298 K to 258 K?
What is the classification scheme used for the family of Al-soc-MOFs in molecular simulation?
data.answer: The name consists of the first letters of arm and core of the linker in the framework.

data.question: What force field was employed for the grand canonical Monte Carlo simulation of methane adsorption in Al-soc-MOFs?
Is the methane working capacity at 5-35 bar and 258 K for the simulated family of Al-soc-MOFs higher for structures with contracted linkers?
What is the role of helium in low pressure gas adsorption measurements?
data.answer: Helium penetrates in all open pores of the materials without being adsorbed, used for buoyancy effect correction.

data.question: What is the highest CH4 gravimetric uptake achieved by Al-soc-MOF-1 at 35 bar and 298 K?
Does the Toth model fit the pure gas isotherms due to its suitable behavior at both low and high pressure?
What is the significance of the Qst value in gas adsorption studies?
data.answer: Qst indicates the heat of adsorption, which helps in understanding the interaction strength between the adsorbate and the adsorbent.
